candidates.name: Charles Holtz
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Born and raised in Catskill, Charles Holtz graduated from Catskill High School in 1991 and earned an A.S. from Columbia-Greene Community College. He is a NYS licensed land surveyor and owner/operator of Holtz Surveying in Catskill. As a parent, he values the work of teachers and educators and pledges support for the district, fiscal responsibility, equitable resources for all students, and accountability for district employees.
key_policies: Accountability and trust through factual investigations
Fair and level treatment of all stakeholders
candidates.additional_notes: Running for one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election. Meet the Candidates forum: May 5, 2025 at 6:00 p.m. in the CHS library.

candidates.name: Paul Brown
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Paul Brown is a Vietnam era US Army veteran (5th Special Forces Group), father of six Catskill High School graduates, and a computer science professional who founded Greene County’s first dial-up internet company. He previously served a five-year term on the Catskill School Board, during which he helped approve construction of a new elementary school and plan major capital projects. He advocates fiscal conservatism and support for children with diverse needs, BOCES programs, traditional education, music and arts, and gifted enrichment.
key_policies: Support for children with special needs
Advocacy for BOCES and traditional education methods
Investment in music, arts, and gifted programs
Accountability in capital planning and construction
candidates.additional_notes: Running for one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election.

candidates.name: Patti Dushane
candidates.bio: Patti Dushane is a lifelong Catskill resident, Catskill High School alumna, and retired Catskill CSD employee of 28 years. She currently serves as Executive Director of the Matthew 25 Food Pantry in Catskill. As an incumbent board member, she is dedicated to serving the district’s students, faculty, and staff with commitment and care.
key_policies: Support for students, faculty, and staff
Focused leadership in food security initiatives
candidates.additional_notes: Running for re-election to one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election.

candidates.name: Tracy Darling
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Tracy Darling, a 1992 Catskill High School graduate and parent of two recent CHS alumni, previously served on the board from 2012–2020. She emphasizes the importance of unity, a return to basics in education, and maintaining a strong community-school connection, free from divisive politics or distractions.
key_policies: Focus on student achievement and success
candidates.additional_notes: Running for one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election.

candidates.name: Junait Shah
candidates.currentRole: Challenger for Board of Education Trustee
candidates.bio: Junait Shah is an educator and former Catskill High School principal with nearly two decades of experience as a teacher, professor, and administrator. He previously served on the board following his 2015 election and holds NYS certifications in Spanish, ENL, and school leadership. He and his family are active community volunteers in local sports and mental health services, and he is committed to safe, inclusive, and academically strong schools.
key_policies: Support for mental health and substance abuse services
candidates.additional_notes: Running for one of three open seats in the May 20, 2025 election. Previously placed on administrative leave in 2024; now seeks to help move the district forward.
